doc.name: HttpGet
doc.description: Get the contents of the specified URL and output as a string. This is similar to the java.io.FileReader, except that it has a timeout parameter. If the timeout expires while performing the get, and the timeoutResponse parameter has been set, then send the specified response. If no timeoutResponse has been set, then throw an exception on timeout.
doc.author: Edward A. Lee
doc.port: An output port for transmitting a token containing the status of the request. This is a RecordToken comprised of the response code, response message, a boolean indicating if the request was successful, and a boolean indicating if further action is expected.
doc.property: The end of line character(s). The default value is the value of the line.separator property
The timeout in milliseconds for establishing a connection or reading a value. Set to NONE to specify no timeout. This is an integer that defaults to 30000, giving a timeout of 30 seconds.
The response to send upon timeout. If this is empty, then this actor will throw an exception rather than send a response. This is a string that defaults to empty.
The URL to send the request to. This is a string that defaults to "http://localhost", which refers to a web server on the local host.
